actionid.description: ID of the action.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

esc_period.description: Duration of an escalation step in seconds. Must be greater than 60 seconds. Accepts seconds, time unit with suffix, or a user macro. If set to 0 or 0s, the default action escalation period will be used.Default: 0s.Property behavior:- supported if eventsource of Action object is set to "event created by a trigger", "internal event", or "event created on service status update"

eventsource.description: Type of events that the action will handle.Refer to the event source property for a list of supported event types.Property behavior:- constant- required for create operations

name.description: Name of the action.Property behavior:- required for create operations

status.description: Whether the action is enabled or disabled.Possible values:0 - (default) enabled;1 - disabled.

pause_symptoms.description: Whether to pause escalation if event is a symptom event.Possible values:0 - Don't pause escalation for symptom problems;1 - (default) Pause escalation for symptom problems.Property behavior:- supported if eventsource is set to "event created by a trigger"

pause_suppressed.description: Whether to pause escalation during maintenance periods or not.Possible values:0 - Don't pause escalation;1 - (default) Pause escalation.Property behavior:- supported if eventsource is set to "event created by a trigger"

notify_if_canceled.description: Whether to notify when escalation is canceled.Possible values:0 - Don't notify when escalation is canceled;1 - (default) Notify when escalation is canceled.Property behavior:- supported if eventsource is set to "event created by a trigger"

operationtype.description: Type of operation.Possible values:0 - send message;1 - global script;12 - notify all involved.Property behavior:- required

esc_step_from.description: Step to start escalation from.Default: 1.Property behavior:- supported if eventsource of Action object is set to "event created by a trigger", "internal event", or "event created on service status update"

esc_step_to.description: Step to end escalation at.Default: 1.Property behavior:- supported if eventsource of Action object is set to "event created by a trigger", "internal event", or "event created on service status update"

evaltype.description: Filter condition evaluation method.Possible values:0 - and/or;1 - and;2 - or;3 - custom expression.Property behavior:- required

opcommand.description: Global script to execute.The global script must have the scriptid property defined.Property behavior:- required if operationtype is set to "global script"

opcommand_grp.description: Host groups to run global scripts on.The host groups must have the groupid property defined.Property behavior:- required if eventsource of Action object is set to "event created by a trigger", and operationtype is set to "global script", and opcommand_hst is not set

opcommand_hst.description: Host to run global scripts on.The hosts must have the hostid property defined.Property behavior:- required if eventsource of Action object is set to "event created by a trigger", and operationtype is set to "global script", and opcommand_grp is not set

opconditions.description: Operation conditions used for trigger actions.The operation condition object is described in detail below.

opgroup.description: Host groups to add hosts to.The host groups must have the groupid property defined.Property behavior:- required if operationtype is set to "add to host group" or "remove from host group"

opmessage.description: Object containing the data about the message sent by the update operation.The operation message object is described in detail above.

opmessage_grp.description: User groups to send messages to.The user groups must have the usrgrpid property defined.Property behavior:- required if operationtype is set to "send message" and opmessage_usr is not set

opmessage_usr.description: Users to send messages to.The users must have the userid property defined.Property behavior:- required if operationtype is set to "send message" and opmessage_grp is not set

optemplate.description: Templates to link to the hosts.The templates must have the templateid property defined.Property behavior:- required if operationtype is set to "link template" or "unlink template"

opinventory.description: Inventory mode set host to.The inventory must have the inventory_mode property defined.Property behavior:- required if operationtype is set to "set host inventory mode"

optag.description: Host tags to add or remove.Tags must have tag property defined.The value property is optional. Property behavior:- supported if operationtype is set to "add host tags" or "remove host tags".

default_msg.description: Whether to use the default action message text and subject.Possible values:0 - use the data from the operation;1 - (default) use the data from the media type.

mediatypeid.description: ID of the media type that will be used to send the message.Property behavior:- supported if operationtype of Action operation object, Action recovery operation object, or Action update operation object is set to "send message", or if operationtype of Action update operation object is set to "notify all involved"

message.description: Operation message text.Property behavior:- supported if default_msg is set to "use the data from the operation"

subject.description: Operation message subject.Property behavior:- supported if default_msg is set to "use the data from the operation"

conditiontype.description: Type of condition.Possible values if eventsource of Action object is set to "event created by a trigger":0 - host group;1 - host;2 - trigger;3 - event name;4 - trigger severity;6 - time period;13 - host template;16 - problem is suppressed;25 - event tag;26 - event tag value.Possible values if eventsource of Action object is set to "event created by a discovery rule":7 - host IP;8 - discovered service type;9 - discovered service port;10 - discovery status;11 - uptime or downtime duration;12 - received value;18 - discovery rule;19 - discovery check;20 - proxy;21 - discovery object.Possible values if eventsource of Action object is set to "event created by active agent autoregistration":20 - proxy;22 - host name;24 - host metadata.Possible values if eventsource of Action object is set to "internal event":0 - host group;1 - host;13 - host template;23 - event type;25 - event tag;26 - event tag value.Possible values if eventsource of Action object is set to "event created on service status update":25 - event tag;26 - event tag value;27 - service;28 - service name.Property behavior:- required

value.description: Value to compare with.Property behavior:- required

operator.description: Condition operator.Possible values:0 - (default) equals;1 - does not equal;2 - contains;3 - does not contain;4 - in;5 - is greater than or equals;6 - is less than or equals;7 - not in;8 - matches;9 - does not match;10 - Yes;11 - No.

conditions.description: Set of filter conditions to use for filtering results. The conditions will be sorted in the order of their placement in the formula.Property behavior:- required

eval_formula.description: Generated expression that will be used for evaluating filter conditions. The expression contains IDs that reference specific filter conditions by its formulaid. The value of eval_formula is equal to the value of formula for filters with a custom expression.Property behavior:- read-only

formula.description: User-defined expression to be used for evaluating conditions of filters with a custom expression. The expression must contain IDs that reference specific filter conditions by its formulaid. The IDs used in the expression must exactly match the ones defined in the filter conditions: no condition can remain unused or omitted.Property behavior:- required if evaltype is set to "custom expression"

value2.description: Secondary value to compare with.Property behavior:- required if eventsource of Action object is set to "event created by a trigger", conditiontype is set to any possible value for trigger actions, and the type of condition (see below) is "26"- required if eventsource of Action object is set to "internal event", conditiontype is set to any possible value for internal actions, and the type of condition (see below) is "26"- required if eventsource of Action object is set to "event created on service status update", conditiontype is set to any possible value for service actions, and the type of condition (see below) is "26"

formulaid.description: Arbitrary unique ID that is used to reference the condition from a custom expression. Can only contain capital-case letters. The ID must be defined by the user when modifying filter conditions, but will be generated anew when requesting them afterward.

actionid.description: ID of the action that generated the alert.

alerttype.description: Alert type.Possible values:0 - message;1 - remote command.

clock.description: Time when the alert was generated.

error.description: Error text if there are problems sending a message or running a command.

esc_step.description: Action escalation step during which the alert was generated.

eventid.description: ID of the event that triggered the action.

mediatypeid.description: ID of the media type that was used to send the message.

message.description: Message text.Property behavior:- supported if alerttype is set to "message"

retries.description: Number of times Zabbix tried to send the message.

sendto.description: Address, user name or other identifier of the recipient.Property behavior:- supported if alerttype is set to "message"

status.description: Status indicating whether the action operation has been executed successfully.Possible values if alerttype is set to "message":0 - message not sent;1 - message sent;2 - failed after a number of retries;3 - new alert is not yet processed by alert manager.Possible values if alerttype is set to "remote command":0 - command not run;1 - command run;2 - tried to run the command on Zabbix agent, but it was unavailable.

subject.description: Message subject.Property behavior:- supported if alerttype is set to "message"

userid.description: ID of the user that the message was sent to.

p_eventid.description: ID of problem event, which generated the alert.

acknowledgeid.description: ID of acknowledgment, which generated the alert.

auditid.description: ID of audit log entry. Generated using CUID algorithm.

ip.description: Audit log entry author IP address.

action.description: Audit log entry action.Possible values:0 - Add;1 - Update;2 - Delete;4 - Logout;7 - Execute;8 - Login;9 - Failed login;10 - History clear;11 - Config refresh;12 - Push.

resourcetype.description: Audit log entry resource type.Possible values:0 - User;3 - Media type;4 - Host;5 - Action;6 - Graph;11 - User group;13 - Trigger;14 - Host group;15 - Item;16 - Image;17 - Value map;18 - Service;19 - Map;22 - Web scenario;23 - Discovery rule;25 - Script;26 - Proxy;27 - Maintenance;28 - Regular expression;29 - Macro;30 - Template;31 - Trigger prototype;32 - Icon mapping;33 - Dashboard;34 - Event correlation;35 - Graph prototype;36 - Item prototype;37 - Host prototype;38 - Autoregistration;39 - Module;40 - Settings;41 - Housekeeping;42 - Authentication;43 - Template dashboard;44 - User role;45 - API token;46 - Scheduled report;47 - High availability node;48 - SLA;49 - User directory;50 - Template group;51 - Connector;52 - LLD rule;53 - History.

resourcename.description: Audit log entry resource human readable name.

recordsetid.description: Audit log entry recordset ID. The audit log records created during the same operation will have the same recordset ID. Generated using CUID algorithm.

details.description: Audit log entry details. The details are stored as a JSON object, where each property name is a path to the property or nested object in which the change occurred, and where each value contains the data (in array format) about the change in this property or nested object.Possible value formats:["add"] - Nested object has been added;["add", "<value>"] - The property of the added object equals <value>;["update"] - Nested object has been updated;["update", "<new value>", "<old value>"] - The property of the updated object was changed from <old value> to <new value>;["delete"] - Nested object has been deleted.

http_auth_enabled.description: HTTP authentication.Possible values:0 - (default) Disabled;1 - Enabled.Property behavior:- supported if $ALLOW_HTTP_AUTH is enabled in the frontend configuration file (zabbix.conf.php).

http_login_form.description: Default login form.Possible values:0 - (default) Zabbix login form;1 - HTTP login form.Property behavior:- supported if $ALLOW_HTTP_AUTH is enabled in the frontend configuration file (zabbix.conf.php).

http_strip_domains.description: Domain name to remove.Property behavior:- supported if $ALLOW_HTTP_AUTH is enabled in the frontend configuration file (zabbix.conf.php).

http_case_sensitive.description: HTTP case sensitive login.Possible values:0 - Off;1 - (default) On.Property behavior:- supported if $ALLOW_HTTP_AUTH is enabled in the frontend configuration file (zabbix.conf.php).

ldap_case_sensitive.description: LDAP case sensitive login.Possible values:0 - Off;1 - (default) On.

ldap_userdirectoryid.description: ID of the default user directory for LDAP authentication.Used for user groups with gui_access set to LDAP or System default.Property behavior:- required if ldap_auth_enabled is set to "Enabled"

saml_case_sensitive.description: SAML case sensitive login.Possible values:0 - Off;1 - (default) On.

passwd_min_length.description: Password minimal length requirement.Possible values range from 1 to 70.Default: 8.

passwd_check_rules.description: Password checking rules.Possible bitmap values:0 - Check password length;1 - Check if password uses uppercase and lowercase Latin letters;2 - Check if password uses digits;4 - Check if password uses special characters;8 - (default) Check if password is not in the list of commonly used passwords and does not contain derivations of word "Zabbix" or user's name, last name, or username.This is a bitmask field; any sum of possible bitmap values is acceptable (for example, 15 for checking all rules).

ldap_jit_status.description: Status of LDAP provisioning.Possible values:0 - Disabled for configured LDAP IdPs;1 - Enabled for configured LDAP IdPs.

saml_jit_status.description: Status of SAML provisioning.Possible values:0 - Disabled for configured SAML IdPs;1 - Enabled for configured SAML IdPs.

jit_provision_interval.description: Time interval between JIT provision requests for logged-in user.Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix with month and year support (3600s,60m,1h,1d,1M,1y). Minimum value: 1h.Default: 1h.Available only for LDAP provisioning.

disabled_usrgrpid.description: ID of the user group to assign the deprovisioned user to.The user group must be disabled and cannot be enabled or deleted when configured.Property behavior:- required if ldap_jit_status is set to "Enabled for configured LDAP IdPs", or saml_jit_status is set to "Enabled for configured SAML IdPs"

mfa_status.description: Multi-factor authentication.Possible values:0 - Disabled (for all configured MFA methods);1 - Enabled (for all configured MFA methods).

mfaid.description: Default MFA method for user groups with MFA enabled.Property behavior:- required if mfa_status is set to "Enabled"

tls_accept.description: Type of allowed incoming connections for autoregistration.Possible values:1 - allow unencrypted connections;2 - allow TLS with PSK;3 - allow both unencrypted and TLS with PSK connections.

tls_psk_identity.description: PSK identity; must be paired with only one PSK (across autoregistration, hosts, and proxies).Do not include sensitive information in the PSK identity, as it is sent unencrypted over the network to inform the receiver which PSK to use.Property behavior:- write-only

tls_psk.description: Pre-shared key (PSK); must be at least 32 hex digits.Property behavior:- write-only

correlationid.description: ID of the correlation.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

name.description: Name of the correlation.Property behavior:- required for create operations

status.description: Whether the correlation is enabled or disabled.Possible values:0 - (default) enabled;1 - disabled.

type.description: Type of condition.Possible values:0 - old event tag;1 - new event tag;2 - new event host group;3 - event tag pair;4 - old event tag value;5 - new event tag value.Property behavior:- required

conditions.description: Set of filter conditions to use for filtering results. The conditions will be sorted in the order of their placement in the formula.Property behavior:- required

evaltype.description: Filter condition evaluation method.Possible values:0 - and/or;1 - and;2 - or;3 - custom expression.Property behavior:- required

eval_formula.description: Generated expression that will be used for evaluating filter conditions. The expression contains IDs that reference specific filter conditions by its formulaid. The value of eval_formula is equal to the value of formula for filters with a custom expression.Property behavior:- read-only

formula.description: User-defined expression to be used for evaluating conditions of filters with a custom expression. The expression must contain IDs that reference specific filter conditions by its formulaid. The IDs used in the expression must exactly match the ones defined in the filter conditions: no condition can remain unused or omitted.Property behavior:- required if evaltype is set to "custom expression"

tag.description: Event tag (old or new).Property behavior:- required if type is set to "old event tag", "new event tag", "old event tag value", or "new event tag value"

groupid.description: ID of the host group.Property behavior:- required if type is set to "new event host group"

oldtag.description: Old event tag.Property behavior:- required if type is set to "event tag pair"

newtag.description: Old event tag.Property behavior:- required if type is set to "event tag pair"

value.description: Event tag (old or new) value.Property behavior:- required if type is set to "old event tag value" or "new event tag value"

formulaid.description: Arbitrary unique ID that is used to reference the condition from a custom expression. Can only contain capital-case letters. The ID must be defined by the user when modifying filter conditions, but will be generated anew when requesting them afterward.

operator.description: Condition operator.Property behavior:- required if type is set to "new event host group", "old event tag value", or "new event tag value"

dashboardid.description: ID of the dashboard.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

name.description: Widget field name.Possible values: see Dashboard widget fields.Property behavior:- required

userid.description: ID of the user.Property behavior:- required

private.description: Type of dashboard sharing.Possible values:0 - public dashboard;1 - (default) private dashboard.

display_period.description: Dashboard page display period (in seconds).Possible values: 0, 10, 30, 60, 120, 600, 1800, 3600.Default: 0 (will use the default page display period).

auto_start.description: Auto start slideshow.Possible values:0 - do not auto start slideshow;1 - (default) auto start slideshow.

dashboard_pageid.description: ID of the dashboard page.Property behavior:- read-only

widgets.description: Array of the dashboard widget objects.

widgetid.description: ID of the dashboard widget.Property behavior:- read-only

type.description: Type of the widget field.Possible values:0 - Integer;1 - String;2 - Host group;3 - Host;4 - Item;5 - Item prototype;6 - Graph;7 - Graph prototype;8 - Map;9 - Service;10 - SLA;11 - User;12 - Action;13 - Media type.Property behavior:- required

x.description: A horizontal position from the left side of the dashboard.Possible values range from 0 to 71.

y.description: A vertical position from the top of the dashboard.Possible values range from 0 to 63.

width.description: The widget width.Possible values range from 1 to 72.

height.description: The widget height.Possible values range from 1 to 64.

view_mode.description: The widget view mode.Possible values:0 - (default) default widget view;1 - with hidden header;

fields.description: Array of the dashboard widget field objects.Property behavior:- see individual widgets in Dashboard widget fields

value.description: Widget field value depending on the type.Possible values: see Dashboard widget fields.Property behavior:- required

usrgrpid.description: ID of the user group.Property behavior:- required

permission.description: Type of permission level.Possible values:2 - read only;3 - read-write.Property behavior:- required

source.description: Type of the event.Possible values:0 - event created by a trigger;1 - event created by a discovery rule;2 - event created by active agent autoregistration;3 - internal event;4 - event created on service status update.

object.description: Type of object that is related to the event.Possible values if source is set to "event created by a trigger":0 - trigger.Possible values if source is set to "event created by a discovery rule":1 - discovered host;2 - discovered service.Possible values if source is set to "event created by active agent autoregistration":3 - auto-registered host.Possible values if source is set to "internal event":0 - trigger;4 - item;5 - LLD rule.Possible values if source is set to "event created on service status update":6 - service.

acknowledged.description: Whether the event has been acknowledged.

clock.description: Time when the event was created.

ns.description: Nanoseconds when the event was created.

name.description: Media type defined URL name.

severity.description: Event current severity.Possible values:0 - not classified;1 - information;2 - warning;3 - average;4 - high;5 - disaster.

c_eventid.description: ID of the event that was used to override (close) current event under global correlation rule. See correlationid to identify exact correlation rule.This parameter is only defined when the event is closed by global correlation rule.

correlationid.description: ID of the correlation rule that generated closing of the problem.This parameter is only defined when the event is closed by global correlation rule.

userid.description: ID of the user that closed the event (if the event was closed manually).

suppressed.description: Whether the event is suppressed.Possible values:0 - event is in normal state;1 - event is suppressed.

graphid.description: ID of the graph.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

height.description: Height of the graph in pixels.Property behavior:- required for create operations

name.description: Name of the graph.Property behavior:- required for create operations

width.description: Width of the graph in pixels.Property behavior:- required for create operations

flags.description: Origin of the graph.Possible values:0 - (default) a plain graph;4 - a discovered graph.Property behavior:- read-only

graphtype.description: Graph's layout type.Possible values:0 - (default) normal;1 - stacked;2 - pie;3 - exploded.

show_3d.description: Whether to show pie and exploded graphs in 3D.Possible values:0 - (default) show in 2D;1 - show in 3D.

show_legend.description: Whether to show the legend on the graph.Possible values:0 - hide;1 - (default) show.

show_work_period.description: Whether to show the working time on the graph.Possible values:0 - hide;1 - (default) show.

show_triggers.description: Whether to show the trigger line on the graph.Possible values:0 - hide;1 - (default) show.

templateid.description: ID of the parent template graph.Property behavior:- read-only

yaxismax.description: The fixed maximum value for the Y axis.Default: 100.

yaxismin.description: The fixed minimum value for the Y axis.Default: 0.

ymax_itemid.description: ID of the item that is used as the maximum value for the Y axis.If a user has no access to the specified item, the graph is rendered as if ymax_type is set to "calculated".

ymax_type.description: Maximum value calculation method for the Y axis.Possible values:0 - (default) calculated;1 - fixed;2 - item.

ymin_itemid.description: ID of the item that is used as the minimum value for the Y axis.If a user has no access to the specified item, the graph is rendered as if ymin_type is set to "calculated".

ymin_type.description: Minimum value calculation method for the Y axis.Possible values:0 - (default) calculated;1 - fixed;2 - item.

uuid.description: Universal unique identifier, used for linking imported graphs to already existing ones. Auto-generated, if not given.Property behavior:- supported if the graph belongs to a template

gitemid.description: ID of the graph item.Property behavior:- read-only

color.description: Graph item's draw color as a hexadecimal color code.Property behavior:- required for create operations

itemid.description: ID of the item.Property behavior:- required for create operations

calc_fnc.description: Value of the item that will be displayed.Possible values:1 - minimum value;2 - (default) average value;4 - maximum value;7 - all values;9 - last value, used only by pie and exploded graphs.

drawtype.description: Draw style of the graph item.Possible values:0 - (default) line;1 - filled region;2 - bold line;3 - dot;4 - dashed line;5 - gradient line.

graphid.description: ID of the graph that the graph item belongs to.

sortorder.description: Position of the item in the graph.Default: starts with "0" and increases by one with each entry.

type.description: Type of graph item.Possible values:0 - (default) simple;2 - graph sum, used only by pie and exploded graphs.

yaxisside.description: Side of the graph where the graph item's Y scale will be drawn.Possible values:0 - (default) left side;1 - right side.

graphid.description: ID of the graph prototype.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

height.description: Height of the graph prototype in pixels.Property behavior:- required for create operations

name.description: Name of the graph prototype.Property behavior:- required for create operations

width.description: Width of the graph prototype in pixels.Property behavior:- required for create operations

graphtype.description: Graph prototypes's layout type.Possible values:0 - (default) normal;1 - stacked;2 - pie;3 - exploded.

show_3d.description: Whether to show discovered pie and exploded graphs in 3D.Possible values:0 - (default) show in 2D;1 - show in 3D.

show_legend.description: Whether to show the legend on the discovered graph.Possible values:0 - hide;1 - (default) show.

show_work_period.description: Whether to show the working time on the discovered graph.Possible values:0 - hide;1 - (default) show.

templateid.description: ID of the parent template graph prototype.Property behavior:- read-only

yaxismax.description: The fixed maximum value for the Y axis.

yaxismin.description: The fixed minimum value for the Y axis.

ymax_itemid.description: ID of the item that is used as the maximum value for the Y axis.If a user has no access to the specified item, the graph is rendered as if ymax_type is set to "calculated".

ymax_type.description: Maximum value calculation method for the Y axis.Possible values:0 - (default) calculated;1 - fixed;2 - item.

ymin_itemid.description: ID of the item that is used as the minimum value for the Y axis.If a user has no access to the specified item, the graph is rendered as if ymin_type is set to "calculated".

ymin_type.description: Minimum value calculation method for the Y axis.Possible values:0 - (default) calculated;1 - fixed;2 - item.

discover.description: Graph prototype discovery status.Possible values:0 - (default) new graphs will be discovered;1 - new graphs will not be discovered and existing graphs will be marked as lost.

uuid.description: Universal unique identifier, used for linking imported graph prototypes to already existing ones. Auto-generated, if not given.Property behavior:- supported if the graph prototype belongs to a template

clock.description: Time when that value was received.

ns.description: Nanoseconds when the value was received.

hostid.description: ID of the host.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

host.description: Technical name of the host.Property behavior:- required for create operations

flags.description: Origin of the host.Possible values:0 - a plain host;4 - a discovered host.Property behavior:- read-only

inventory_mode.description: Host inventory population mode.Possible values:-1 - (default) disabled;0 - manual;1 - automatic.

ipmi_authtype.description: IPMI authentication algorithm.Possible values:-1 - (default) default;0 - none;1 - MD2;2 - MD54 - straight;5 - OEM;6 - RMCP+.

ipmi_privilege.description: IPMI privilege level.Possible values:1 - callback;2 - (default) user;3 - operator;4 - admin;5 - OEM.

maintenance_from.description: Starting time of the effective maintenance.Property behavior:- read-only

maintenance_status.description: Effective maintenance status.Possible values:0 - (default) no maintenance;1 - maintenance in effect.Property behavior:- read-only

maintenance_type.description: Effective maintenance type.Possible values:0 - (default) maintenance with data collection;1 - maintenance without data collection.Property behavior:- read-only

maintenanceid.description: ID of the maintenance that is currently in effect on the host.Property behavior:- read-only

name.description: Visible name of the host.Default: host property value.

monitored_by.description: Source that is used to monitor the host.Possible values:0 - (default) Zabbix server;1 - Proxy;2 - Proxy group.

proxyid.description: ID of the proxy that is used to monitor the host.Property behavior:- required if monitored_by is set to "Proxy"

proxy_groupid.description: ID of the proxy group that is used to monitor the host.Property behavior:- required if monitored_by is set to "Proxy group"

status.description: Status and function of the host.Possible values:0 - (default) monitored host;1 - unmonitored host.

tls_connect.description: Connections to host.Possible values:1 - (default) No encryption;2 - PSK;4 - certificate.

tls_accept.description: Connections from host.Possible bitmap values:1 - (default) No encryption;2 - PSK;4 - certificate.This is a bitmask field; any sum of possible bitmap values is acceptable (for example, 6 for PSK and certificate).

tls_psk_identity.description: PSK identity; must be paired with only one PSK (across autoregistration, hosts, and proxies).Do not include sensitive information in the PSK identity, as it is sent unencrypted over the network to inform the receiver which PSK to use.Property behavior:- write-only- required if tls_connect is set to "PSK", or tls_accept contains the "PSK" bit

tls_psk.description: Pre-shared key (PSK); must be at least 32 hex digits.Property behavior:- write-only- required if tls_connect is set to "PSK", or tls_accept contains the "PSK" bit

active_available.description: Host active interface availability status.Possible values:0 - interface status is unknown;1 - interface is available;2 - interface is not available.Property behavior:- read-only

assigned_proxyid.description: ID of the proxy assigned by Zabbix server, if the host is monitored by a proxy group.Property behavior:- read-only

automatic.description: Type of host tag.Possible values:0 - (default) manual (tag created by user);1 - automatic (tag created by low-level discovery)

groupid.description: ID of the host group.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

name.description: Name of the host group.Property behavior:- required for create operations

flags.description: Origin of the host group.Possible values:0 - a plain host group;4 - a discovered host group.Property behavior:- read-only

uuid.description: Universal unique identifier, used for linking imported host groups to already existing ones. Auto-generated, if not given.

interfaceid.description: ID of the interface.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

available.description: Availability of host interface.Possible values:0 - (default) unknown;1 - available;2 - unavailable.Property behavior:- read-only

hostid.description: ID of the host that the interface belongs to.Property behavior:- constant- required for create operations

type.description: Interface type.Possible values:1 - Agent;2 - SNMP;3 - IPMI;4 - JMX.Property behavior:- required for create operations

ip.description: IP address used by the interface.Can be empty if the connection is made via DNS.Property behavior:- required for create operations

dns.description: DNS name used by the interface.Can be empty if the connection is made via IP.Property behavior:- required for create operations

port.description: Port number used by the interface.Can contain user macros.Property behavior:- required for create operations

useip.description: Whether the connection should be made via IP.Possible values:0 - connect using host DNS name;1 - connect using host IP address.Property behavior:- required for create operations

main.description: Whether the interface is used as default on the host. Only one interface of some type can be set as default on a host.Possible values:0 - not default;1 - default.Property behavior:- required for create operations

details.description: Additional details object for interface.Property behavior:- required if type is set to "SNMP"

disable_until.description: The next polling time of an unavailable host interface.Property behavior:- read-only

error.description: Error text if host interface is unavailable.Property behavior:- read-only

errors_from.description: Time when host interface became unavailable.Property behavior:- read-only

version.description: SNMP interface version.Possible values:1 - SNMPv1;2 - SNMPv2c;3 - SNMPv3.Property behavior:- required

bulk.description: Whether to use bulk SNMP requests.Possible values:0 - don't use bulk requests;1 - (default) - use bulk requests.

community.description: SNMP community. Used only by SNMPv1 and SNMPv2 interfaces.Property behavior:- required if version is set to "SNMPv1" or "SNMPv2c"

max_repetitions.description: Max repetition value for native SNMP bulk requests (GetBulkRequest-PDUs).Used only for discovery[] and walk[] items in SNMPv2 and v3.Default: 10.

securityname.description: SNMPv3 security name. Used only by SNMPv3 interfaces.

securitylevel.description: SNMPv3 security level. Used only by SNMPv3 interfaces.Possible values:0 - (default) - noAuthNoPriv;1 - authNoPriv;2 - authPriv.

authpassphrase.description: SNMPv3 authentication passphrase. Used only by SNMPv3 interfaces.

privpassphrase.description: SNMPv3 privacy passphrase. Used only by SNMPv3 interfaces.

authprotocol.description: SNMPv3 authentication protocol. Used only by SNMPv3 interfaces.Possible values:0 - (default) - MD5;1 - SHA1;2 - SHA224;3 - SHA256;4 - SHA384;5 - SHA512.

privprotocol.description: SNMPv3 privacy protocol. Used only by SNMPv3 interfaces.Possible values:0 - (default) - DES;1 - AES128;2 - AES192;3 - AES256;4 - AES192C;5 - AES256C.

contextname.description: SNMPv3 context name. Used only by SNMPv3 interfaces.

hostid.description: ID of the host prototype.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

host.description: Technical name of the host prototype.Property behavior:- required for create operations- read-only for inherited objects

name.description: Name of the group prototype.Property behavior:- required

status.description: Status of the host prototype.Possible values:0 - (default) monitored host;1 - unmonitored host.

inventory_mode.description: Host inventory population mode.Possible values:-1 - (default) disabled;0 - manual;1 - automatic.

templateid.description: ID of the parent template host prototype.Property behavior:- read-only

discover.description: Host prototype discovery status.Possible values:0 - (default) new hosts will be discovered;1 - new hosts will not be discovered and existing hosts will be marked as lost.

custom_interfaces.description: Source of custom interfaces for hosts created by the host prototype.Possible values:0 - (default) inherit interfaces from parent host;1 - use host prototypes custom interfaces.Property behavior:- read-only for inherited objects

uuid.description: Universal unique identifier, used for linking imported host prototypes to already existing ones. Auto-generated, if not given.Property behavior:- supported if the host prototype belongs to a template

groupid.description: ID of the host group.Property behavior:- required

tag.description: Host prototype tag name.Property behavior:- required

type.description: Interface type.Possible values:1 - Agent;2 - SNMP;3 - IPMI;4 - JMX.Property behavior:- required

useip.description: Whether the connection should be made via IP.Possible values:0 - connect using host DNS name;1 - connect using host IP address.Property behavior:- required

ip.description: IP address used by the interface.Can contain macros.Property behavior:- required if useip is set to "connect using host IP address"

dns.description: DNS name used by the interface.Can contain macros.Property behavior:- required if useip is set to "connect using host DNS name"

port.description: Port number used by the interface.Can contain user and LLD macros.Property behavior:- required

main.description: Whether the interface is used as default on the host.Only one interface of some type can be set as default on a host.Possible values:0 - not default;1 - default.Property behavior:- required

details.description: Additional object for interface.Property behavior:- required if type is set to "SNMP"

version.description: SNMP interface version.Possible values:1 - SNMPv1;2 - SNMPv2c;3 - SNMPv3.Property behavior:- required

bulk.description: Whether to use bulk SNMP requests.Possible values:0 - don't use bulk requests;1 - (default) - use bulk requests.

community.description: SNMP community.Property behavior:- required if version is set to "SNMPv1" or "SNMPv2c"

max_repetitions.description: Max repetition value for native SNMP bulk requests (GetBulkRequest-PDUs).Used only for discovery[] and walk[] items in SNMPv2 and v3.Default: 10.

securityname.description: SNMPv3 security name.Property behavior:- supported if version is set to "SNMPv3"

securitylevel.description: SNMPv3 security level.Possible values:0 - (default) - noAuthNoPriv;1 - authNoPriv;2 - authPriv.Property behavior:- supported if version is set to "SNMPv3"

authpassphrase.description: SNMPv3 authentication passphrase.Property behavior:- supported if version is set to "SNMPv3" and securitylevel is set to "authNoPriv" or "authPriv"

privpassphrase.description: SNMPv3 privacy passphrase.Property behavior:- supported if version is set to "SNMPv3" and securitylevel is set to "authPriv"

authprotocol.description: SNMPv3 authentication protocol.Possible values:0 - (default) - MD5;1 - SHA1;2 - SHA224;3 - SHA256;4 - SHA384;5 - SHA512.Property behavior:- supported if version is set to "SNMPv3" and securitylevel is set to "authNoPriv" or "authPriv"

privprotocol.description: SNMPv3 privacy protocol. Used only by SNMPv3 interfaces.Possible values:0 - (default) - DES;1 - AES128;2 - AES192;3 - AES256;4 - AES192C;5 - AES256C.Property behavior:- supported if version is set to "SNMPv3" and securitylevel is set to "authPriv"

contextname.description: SNMPv3 context name.Property behavior:- supported if version is set to "SNMPv3"

hk_events_mode.description: Enable internal housekeeping for events and alerts.Possible values:0 - Disable;1 - (default) Enable.

hk_events_trigger.description: Trigger data storage period. Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix.Default: 365d.

hk_events_service.description: Service data storage period. Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix.Default: 1d.

hk_events_internal.description: Internal data storage period. Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix.Default: 1d.

hk_events_discovery.description: Network discovery data storage period. Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix.Default: 1d.

hk_events_autoreg.description: Autoregistration data storage period. Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix.Default: 1d.

hk_services_mode.description: Enable internal housekeeping for services.Possible values:0 - Disable;1 - (default) Enable.

hk_services.description: Services data storage period. Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix.Default: 365d.

hk_audit_mode.description: Enable internal housekeeping for audit.Possible values:0 - Disable;1 - (default) Enable.

hk_audit.description: Audit data storage period. Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix.Default: 31d.

hk_sessions_mode.description: Enable internal housekeeping for sessions.Possible values:0 - Disable;1 - (default) Enable.

hk_sessions.description: Sessions data storage period. Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix.Default: 365d.

hk_history_mode.description: Enable internal housekeeping for history.Possible values:0 - Disable;1 - (default) Enable.

hk_history_global.description: Override item history period.Possible values:0 - Do not override;1 - (default) Override.

hk_history.description: History data storage period. Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix.Default: 31d.

hk_trends_mode.description: Enable internal housekeeping for trends.Possible values:0 - Disable;1 - (default) Enable.

hk_trends_global.description: Override item trend period.Possible values:0 - Do not override;1 - (default) Override.

hk_trends.description: Trends data storage period. Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix.Default: 365d.

db_extension.description: Configuration flag DB extension. If this flag is set to "timescaledb" then the server changes its behavior for housekeeping and item deletion.Property behavior:- read-only

compression_availability.description: Whether data compression is supported by the database (or its extension).Possible values:0 - Unavailable;1 - Available.Property behavior:- read-only

compression_status.description: Enable TimescaleDB compression for history and trends.Possible values:0 - (default) Off;1 - On.

compress_older.description: Compress history and trends records older than specified period. Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix.Default: 7d.

iconmapid.description: ID of the icon map.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

default_iconid.description: ID of the default icon.Property behavior:- required for create operations

name.description: Name of the icon map.Property behavior:- required for create operations

iconid.description: ID of the icon used by the icon mapping.Property behavior:- required

expression.description: Expression to match the inventory field against.Property behavior:- required

inventory_link.description: ID of the host inventory field.Refer to the host inventory object for a list of supported inventory fields.Property behavior:- required

sortorder.description: Position of the icon mapping in the icon map.Property behavior:- read-only

imageid.description: ID of the image.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

name.description: Name of the image.Property behavior:- required for create operations

imagetype.description: Type of image.Possible values:1 - (default) icon;2 - background image.Property behavior:- constant- required for create operations

image.description: Base64 encoded image.The maximum size of the encoded image is 1 MB. Maximum size can be adjusted by changing ZBX_MAX_IMAGE_SIZE constant value.Supported image formats: PNG, JPEG, GIF.Property behavior:- required for create operations

maintenanceid.description: ID of the maintenance.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

name.description: Name of the maintenance.Property behavior:- required for create operations

active_since.description: Time when the maintenance becomes active.The given value will be rounded down to minutes.Property behavior:- required for create operations

active_till.description: Time when the maintenance stops being active.The given value will be rounded down to minutes.Property behavior:- required for create operations

maintenance_type.description: Type of maintenance.Possible values:0 - (default) with data collection;1 - without data collection.

tags_evaltype.description: Problem tag evaluation method.Possible values:0 - (default) And/Or;2 - Or.

period.description: Duration of the maintenance period in seconds.The given value will be rounded down to minutes.Default: 3600.

timeperiod_type.description: Type of time period.Possible values:0 - (default) one time only;2 - daily;3 - weekly;4 - monthly.

start_date.description: Date when the maintenance period must come into effect.The given value will be rounded down to minutes.Default: current date.Property behavior:- supported if timeperiod_type is set to "one time only"

start_time.description: Time of day when the maintenance starts in seconds.The given value will be rounded down to minutes.Default: 0.Property behavior:- supported if timeperiod_type is set to "daily", "weekly", or "monthly"

every.description: For daily and weekly periods every defines the day or week intervals at which the maintenance must come into effect.Default value if timeperiod_type is set to "daily" or "weekly": 1.For monthly periods when day is set, the every property defines the day of the month when the maintenance must come into effect.Default value if timeperiod_type is set to "monthly" and day is set: 1.For monthly periods when dayofweek is set, the every property defines the week of the month when the maintenance must come into effect.Possible values if timeperiod_type is set to "monthly" and dayofweek is set:1 - (default) first week;2 - second week;3 - third week;4 - fourth week;5 - last week.Property behavior:- supported if timeperiod_type is set to "daily", "weekly", or "monthly"

dayofweek.description: Days of the week when the maintenance must come into effect.Possible bitmap values:1 - Monday;2 - Tuesday;4 - Wednesday;8 - Thursday;16 - Friday;32 - Saturday;64 - Sunday.This is a bitmask field; any sum of possible bitmap values is acceptable (for example, 21 for Monday, Wednesday, and Friday).Property behavior:- required if timeperiod_type is set to "weekly" or if timeperiod_type is set to "monthly" and day is not set

day.description: Day of the month when the maintenance must come into effect.Property behavior:- required if timeperiod_type is set to "monthly" and dayofweek is not set

month.description: Months when the maintenance must come into effect.Possible bitmap values:1 - January;2 - February;4 - March;8 - April;16 - May;32 - June;64 - July;128 - August;256 - September;512 - October;1024 - November;2048 - December.This is a bitmask field; any sum of possible bitmap values is acceptable (for example, 585 for January, April, July, and October).Property behavior:- required if timeperiod_type is set to "monthly"

sysmapid.description: ID of the map that the URL belongs to.

height.description: Height of the shape in pixels.Default: 200.

name.description: Link caption.Property behavior:- required

width.description: Width of the shape in pixels.Default: 200.

backgroundid.description: ID of the image used as the background for the map.

expand_macros.description: Whether to expand macros in labels when configuring the map.Possible values:0 - (default) do not expand macros;1 - expand macros.

expandproblem.description: Whether the problem trigger will be displayed for elements with a single problem.Possible values:0 - always display the number of problems;1 - (default) display the problem trigger if there's only one problem.

grid_align.description: Whether to enable grid aligning.Possible values:0 - disable grid aligning;1 - (default) enable grid aligning.

grid_show.description: Whether to show the grid on the map.Possible values:0 - do not show the grid;1 - (default) show the grid.

grid_size.description: Size of the map grid in pixels.Supported values: 20, 40, 50, 75 and 100.Default: 50.

highlight.description: Whether icon highlighting is enabled.Possible values:0 - highlighting disabled;1 - (default) highlighting enabled.

iconmapid.description: ID of the icon map used on the map.

label_format.description: Whether to enable advanced labels.Possible values:0 - (default) disable advanced labels;1 - enable advanced labels.

label_location.description: Location of the map element label.Possible values:-1 - (default) default location;0 - bottom;1 - left;2 - right;3 - top.

label_string_host.description: Custom label for host elements.Property behavior:- required if label_type_host is set to "custom"

label_string_hostgroup.description: Custom label for host group elements.Property behavior:- required if label_type_hostgroup is set to "custom"

label_string_image.description: Custom label for image elements.Property behavior:- required if label_type_image is set to "custom"

label_string_map.description: Custom label for map elements.Property behavior:- required if label_type_map is set to "custom"

label_string_trigger.description: Custom label for trigger elements.Property behavior:- required if label_type_trigger is set to "custom"

label_type.description: Map element label type.Possible values:0 - label;1 - IP address;2 - (default) element name;3 - status only;4 - nothing.

label_type_host.description: Label type for host elements.Possible values:0 - label;1 - IP address;2 - (default) element name;3 - status only;4 - nothing;5 - custom.

label_type_hostgroup.description: Label type for host group elements.Possible values:0 - label;2 - (default) element name;3 - status only;4 - nothing;5 - custom.

label_type_image.description: Label type for host group elements.Possible values:0 - label;2 - (default) element name;4 - nothing;5 - custom.

label_type_map.description: Label type for map elements.Possible values:0 - label;2 - (default) element name;3 - status only;4 - nothing;5 - custom.

label_type_trigger.description: Label type for trigger elements.Possible values:0 - label;2 - (default) element name;3 - status only;4 - nothing;5 - custom.

markelements.description: Whether to highlight map elements that have recently changed their status.Possible values:0 - (default) do not highlight elements;1 - highlight elements.

severity_min.description: Minimum severity of the triggers that will be displayed on the map.Refer to the trigger severity property for a list of supported trigger severities.

show_unack.description: How problems should be displayed.Possible values:0 - (default) display the count of all problems;1 - display only the count of unacknowledged problems;2 - display the count of acknowledged and unacknowledged problems separately.

userid.description: ID of the user.Property behavior:- required

private.description: Type of map sharing.Possible values:0 - public map;1 - (default) private map.

show_suppressed.description: Whether suppressed problems are shown.Possible values:0 - (default) hide suppressed problems;1 - show suppressed problems.

selementid.description: ID of the map element that the URL belongs to.

elements.description: Element data object.Property behavior:- required if elementtype is set to "host", "map", "trigger" or "host group"

elementtype.description: Type of map element for which the URL will be available.Refer to the map element type property for a list of supported types.Default: 0.

iconid_off.description: ID of the image used to display the element in default state.Property behavior:- required

areatype.description: How separate host group hosts should be displayed.Possible values:0 - (default) the host group element will take up the whole map;1 - the host group element will have a fixed size.

elementsubtype.description: How a host group element should be displayed on a map.Possible values:0 - (default) display the host group as a single element;1 - display each host in the group separately.

evaltype.description: Map element tag filtering condition evaluation method.Possible values:0 - (default) AND / OR;2 - OR.

iconid_disabled.description: ID of the image used to display disabled map elements.Property behavior:- supported if elementtype is set to "host", "map", "trigger", or "host group"

iconid_maintenance.description: ID of the image used to display map elements in maintenance.Property behavior:- supported if elementtype is set to "host", "map", "trigger", or "host group"

iconid_on.description: ID of the image used to display map elements with problems.Property behavior:- supported if elementtype is set to "host", "map", "trigger", or "host group"

permission.description: Type of permission level.Possible values:2 - read only;3 - read-write.Property behavior:- required

urls.description: Map element URLs.The map element URL object is described in detail below.

use_iconmap.description: Whether icon mapping must be used for host elements.Possible values:0 - do not use icon mapping;1 - (default) use icon mapping.

viewtype.description: Host group element placing algorithm.Possible values:0 - (default) grid.

x.description: X-coordinates of the shape in pixels.Default: 0.

y.description: Y-coordinates of the shape in pixels.Default: 0.

triggerid.description: ID of the trigger used as a link indicator.Property behavior:- required

tag.description: Map element tag name.Property behavior:- required

operator.description: Map element tag condition operator.Possible values:0 - (default) Contains;1 - Equals;2 - Does not contain;3 - Does not equal;4 - Exists;5 - Does not exist.

sysmapelementurlid.description: ID of the map element URL.Property behavior:- read-only

linkid.description: ID of the map link that the link trigger belongs to.

selementid1.description: ID of the first map element linked on one end.Property behavior:- required

selementid2.description: ID of the first map element linked on the other end.Property behavior:- required

color.description: Indicator color as a hexadecimal color code.Default: DD0000.

drawtype.description: Indicator draw style.Possible values:0 - (default) line;2 - bold line;3 - dotted line;4 - dashed line.

linktriggers.description: Map link triggers to use as link status indicators.The map link trigger object is described in detail below.

linktriggerid.description: ID of the map link trigger.Property behavior:- read-only

sysmapurlid.description: ID of the map URL.Property behavior:- read-only

sysmapuserid.description: ID of the map user.Property behavior:- read-only

sysmapusrgrpid.description: ID of the map user group.Property behavior:- read-only

usrgrpid.description: ID of the user group.Property behavior:- required

sysmap_shapeid.description: ID of the map shape element.Property behavior:- read-only

type.description: Type of map shape element.Possible values:0 - rectangle;1 - ellipse.Property is required when new shapes are created.Property behavior:- required

font.description: Font of the text within shape.Possible values:0 - Georgia, serif1 - “Palatino Linotype”, “Book Antiqua”, Palatino, serif2 - “Times New Roman”, Times, serif3 - Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif4 - “Arial Black”, Gadget, sans-serif5 - “Comic Sans MS”, cursive, sans-serif6 - Impact, Charcoal, sans-serif7 - “Lucida Sans Unicode”, “Lucida Grande”, sans-serif8 - Tahoma, Geneva, sans-serif9 - “Trebuchet MS”, Helvetica, sans-serif10 - Verdana, Geneva, sans-serif11 - “Courier New”, Courier, monospace12 - “Lucida Console”, Monaco, monospaceDefault: 9.

text_halign.description: Horizontal alignment of text.Possible values:0 - center;1 - left;2 - right.Default: 0.

text_valign.description: Vertical alignment of text.Possible values:0 - middle;1 - top;2 - bottom.Default: 0.

border_type.description: Type of the border.Possible values:0 - none;1 - —————;2 - ·····;3 - - - -.Default: 0.

border_width.description: Width of the border in pixels.Default: 0.

zindex.description: Value used to order all shapes and lines (z-index).Default: 0.

x1.description: X-coordinates of the line point 1 in pixels.Default: 0.

y1.description: Y-coordinates of the line point 1 in pixels.Default: 0.

x2.description: X-coordinates of the line point 2 in pixels.Default: 200.

y2.description: Y-coordinates of the line point 2 in pixels.Default: 200.

line_type.description: Type of the lines.Possible values:0 - none;1 - —————;2 - ·····;3 - - - -.Default: 0.

line_width.description: Width of the lines in pixels.Default: 0.

mediatypeid.description: ID of the media type.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

name.description: Parameter name.Property behavior:- required

type.description: Transport used by the media type.Possible values:0 - Email;1 - Script;2 - SMS;4 - Webhook.Property behavior:- required for create operations

exec_path.description: For script media types exec_path contains the name of the executed script.Property behavior:- required if type is set to "Script"

gsm_modem.description: Serial device name of the GSM modem.Property behavior:- required if type is set to "SMS"

passwd.description: Authentication password.Property behavior:- supported if type is set to "Email"

smtp_email.description: Email address from which notifications will be sent.Property behavior:- required if type is set to "Email"

smtp_helo.description: SMTP HELO.Property behavior:- required if type is set to "Email"

smtp_server.description: SMTP server.Property behavior:- required if type is set to "Email"

smtp_port.description: SMTP server port to connect to.

smtp_security.description: SMTP connection security level to use.Possible values:0 - None;1 - STARTTLS;2 - SSL/TLS.

smtp_verify_host.description: SSL verify host for SMTP.Possible values:0 - No;1 - Yes.

smtp_verify_peer.description: SSL verify peer for SMTP.Possible values:0 - No;1 - Yes.

smtp_authentication.description: SMTP authentication method to use.Possible values:0 - None;1 - Normal password.

status.description: Whether the media type is enabled.Possible values:0 - (default) Enabled;1 - Disabled.

username.description: User name.Property behavior:- supported if type is set to "Email"

maxsessions.description: The maximum number of alerts that can be processed in parallel.Possible values if type is set to "SMS": (default) 1.Possible values if type is set to "Email", "Script", or "Webhook": 0-100.

maxattempts.description: The maximum number of attempts to send an alert.Possible values: 1-100.Default value: 3.

attempt_interval.description: The interval between retry attempts. Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix.Possible values: 0-1h.Default value: 10s.

content_type(deprecated).description: This parameter is deprecated, please use message_format instead.Message format.Possible values:0 - plain text;1 - (default) html.

message_format.description: Message format.Possible values:0 - plain text;1 - (default) html.

script.description: Media type webhook script javascript body.

timeout.description: Media type webhook script timeout.Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix.Possible values: 1-60s.Default: 30s.

process_tags.description: Defines should the webhook script response to be interpreted as tags and these tags should be added to associated event.Possible values:0 - (default) Ignore webhook script response;1 - Process webhook script response as tags.

show_event_menu.description: Show media type entry in problem.get and event.get property urls.Possible values:0 - (default) Do not add urls entry;1 - Add media type to urls property.

event_menu_url.description: Define url property of media type entry in urls property of problem.get and event.get.

event_menu_name.description: Define name property of media type entry in urls property of problem.get and event.get.

parameters.description: Array of webhook or script input parameters.

value.description: Parameter value, supports macros.Supported macros are described on the Supported macros page.

sortorder.description: The order in which the parameters will be passed to the script as command-line arguments, starting with 0 as the first one.Property behavior:- required

eventsource.description: Event source.Possible values:0 - triggers;1 - discovery;2 - autoregistration;3 - internal;4 - services.Property behavior:- required

recovery.description: Operation mode.Possible values:0 - operations;1 - recovery operations;2 - update operations.Property behavior:- required

source.description: Type of the problem event.Possible values:0 - event created by a trigger;3 - internal event;4 - event created on service status update.

object.description: Type of object that is related to the problem event.Possible values if source is set to "event created by a trigger":0 - trigger.Possible values if source is set to "internal event":0 - trigger;4 - item;5 - LLD rule.Possible values if source is set to "event created on service status update":6 - service.

clock.description: Time when the problem event was created.

ns.description: Nanoseconds when the problem event was created.

r_clock.description: Time when the recovery event was created.

r_ns.description: Nanoseconds when the recovery event was created.

correlationid.description: ID of the correlation rule if this event was recovered by a global correlation rule.

userid.description: ID of the user that closed the problem (if the problem was closed manually).

name.description: Media type defined URL name.

acknowledged.description: Acknowledge state for problem.Possible values:0 - not acknowledged;1 - acknowledged.

severity.description: Problem current severity.Possible values:0 - not classified;1 - information;2 - warning;3 - average;4 - high;5 - disaster.

suppressed.description: Whether the problem is suppressed.Possible values:0 - problem is in normal state;1 - problem is suppressed.

reportid.description: ID of the report.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

userid.description: ID of user to send the report to.Property behavior:- required

name.description: Unique name of the report.Property behavior:- required for create operations

dashboardid.description: ID of the dashboard that the report is based on.Property behavior:- required for create operations

period.description: Period for which the report will be prepared.Possible values:0 - (default) previous day;1 - previous week;2 - previous month;3 - previous year.

cycle.description: Period repeating schedule.Possible values:0 - (default) daily;1 - weekly;2 - monthly;3 - yearly.

start_time.description: Time of the day, in seconds, when the report will be prepared for sending.Default: 0.

weekdays.description: Days of the week for sending the report.Possible bitmap values:1 - Monday;2 - Tuesday;4 - Wednesday;8 - Thursday;16 - Friday;32 - Saturday;64 - Sunday.This is a bitmask field; any sum of possible bitmap values is acceptable (for example, 21 for Monday, Wednesday, and Friday).Default: 0.Property behavior:- required if cycle is set to "weekly".

active_since.description: On which date to start.Possible values:empty string - (default) not specified (stored as 0);specific date in YYYY-MM-DD format (stored as a timestamp of the beginning of a day (00:00:00)).

active_till.description: On which date to end.Possible values:empty string - (default) not specified (stored as 0);specific date in YYYY-MM-DD format (stored as a timestamp of the end of a day (23:59:59)).

status.description: Whether the report is enabled or disabled.Possible values:0 - Disabled;1 - (default) Enabled.

state.description: State of the report.Possible values:0 - (default) report was not yet processed;1 - report was generated and successfully sent to all recipients;2 - report generating failed; "info" contains error information;3 - report was generated, but sending to some (or all) recipients failed; "info" contains error information.Property behavior:- read-only

lastsent.description: Unix timestamp of the last successfully sent report.Property behavior:- read-only

info.description: Error description or additional information.Property behavior:- read-only

access_userid.description: ID of user on whose behalf the report will be generated.0 - (default) Generate report by recipient.

exclude.description: Whether to exclude the user from mailing list.Possible values:0 - (default) Include;1 - Exclude.

usrgrpid.description: ID of user group to send the report to.Property behavior:- required

roleid.description: ID of the role.Property behavior:- read-only- required for update operations

delay.description:
Update interval of the item.

Accepts seconds or time unit with suffix (e.g., 30s, 1m, 2h, 1d) and, optionally, one or more custom intervals, all separated by semicolons. Custom intervals can be a mix of flexible and scheduling intervals.

Accepts user macros. If used, the value must be a single macro. Multiple macros or macros mixed with text are not supported. Flexible intervals may be written as two macros separated by a forward slash (e.g., {$FLEX_INTERVAL}/{$FLEX_PERIOD}).

Example:
1h;wd1-5h9-18;{$Macro1}/1-7,00:00-24:00;0/6-7,12:00-24:00;{$Macro2}/{$Macro3}

Property behavior:
- required if type is set to "Zabbix agent" (0), "Simple check" (3), "Zabbix internal" (5), "External check" (10), "Database monitor" (11), "IPMI agent" (12), "SSH agent" (13), "TELNET agent" (14), "Calculated" (15), "JMX agent" (16), "HTTP agent" (19), "SNMP agent" (20), "Script" (21), "Browser" (22), or if type is set to "Zabbix agent (active)" (7) and key_ does not contain "mqtt.get"

- read-only for inherited objects (if type is set to "HTTP agent") or discovered objects

uuid.description:
Universal unique identifier, used for linking imported item to already existing ones. Auto-generated, if not given.

Property behavior:
- supported if the item belongs to a template

valuemapid.description:
ID of the associated value map.

Property behavior:
- supported if value_type is set to "numeric float", "character", or "numeric unsigned"
- read-only for inherited objects or discovered objects

verify_host.description:
Whether to validate that the host name for the connection matches the one in the host's certificate.

Property behavior:
- supported if type is set to "HTTP agent"
- read-only for inherited objects or discovered objects

verify_peer.description:
Whether to validate that the host's certificate is authentic.

Property behavior:
- supported if type is set to "HTTP agent"
- read-only for inherited objects or discovered objects

error_handler.description:
Action type used in case of preprocessing step failure.

Property behavior:
- required if type is set to "Custom multiplier" (1), "Regular expression" (5), "Boolean to decimal" (6), "Octal to decimal" (7), "Hexadecimal to decimal" (8), "Simple change" (9), "Change per second" (10), "XML XPath" (11), "JSONPath" (12), "In range" (13), "Matches regular expression" (14), "Does not match regular expression" (15), "Check for error in JSON" (16), "Check for error in XML" (17), "Check for error using regular expression" (18), "Prometheus pattern" (22), "Prometheus to JSON" (23), "CSV to JSON" (24), "Check unsupported" (26), "XML to JSON" (27), "SNMP walk value" (28), "SNMP walk to JSON" (29), or "SNMP get value" (30)

0.description: Error message is set by Zabbix server

3.description:
Set custom error message.

Possible values if type is set to "Check unsupported":
1 - Discard value
2 - Set custom value
3 - Set custom error message.

error_handler_params.description:
Error handler parameters.

Property behavior:
- required if error_handler is set to "Set custom value" or "Set custom error message"
